case_title: Dr. AZIZ BEGUM CHAUDHARY vs PAKISTAN Through Secretary (Establishment Division)

accussed_details.name: Dr. Aziz Begum Chaudhary
accussed_details.designation: Registrar (BPS-17), Jinnah Postgraduate Medical Centre, Karachi
allegation: Declared invalid for government service due to resistant hypertension

complaint_summary: Petitioner challenged her premature retirement from government service on medical grounds, alleging improper constitution of medical boards and unlawful decisions.
investigation_summary: Multiple medical boards convened to assess petitioner’s fitness for service. Initial and appellate boards declared her unfit due to resistant hypertension. Tribunal found appellate board improperly constituted and invalidated its opinion.
judgment_summary: Supreme Court dismissed the petition, upholding the Service Tribunal’s decision to reinstate petitioner with back benefits, while rejecting her appeal against the opinion of the First Medical Board.
Decision_or_verdict: Leave refused; petitioner reinstated with back benefits.
legal_arguments: Improper constitution of Appellate Medical Board
Invalidity of retrospective effect of retirement notification
Finality of First Medical Board’s opinion
key_issues: Improper constitution of appellate medical board

legal_terms.resistant hypertension: A medical condition causing permanent incapacity for service.

summary_vector_notes: Petitioner’s service was terminated twice and reinstated after court interventions. Medical boards declared her unfit due to resistant hypertension. Tribunal invalidated appellate board’s opinion due to improper constitution. Supreme Court dismissed her petition, affirming reinstatement with back benefits.

appeals.decision: Allowed, Appellate Medical Board declared invalid

tribunal_findings.invalid_retirement: Retirement order based on improperly constituted medical board

final_decision.reasoning: Opinion of First Medical Board merged with invalid Appellate Review Board findings.
